channel.title: Flatiron on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Flatiron on Table41NYC

item.title: Upland
item.description: Got eggs in hell, and it was a nice alternative to shakshookas. Somewhat spicy. The price wasn’t too expensive.

item.title: Marta
item.description: Pretty good. The meat one with all the salami was good.

item.title: The Flatiron Room
item.description: Jazzy bluegrassy restaurant. Same people as Fine & Rare.

item.title: Tacombi
item.description: Pretty decent tacos albeit a little expensive. Al Pastor was probably my favorite. Guac was ok too. They have several locations now.

item.title: Atoboy
item.description: Really good for the price point. $39 tasting 3 courses, no tip, and no dessert.

item.title: Kazunori
item.description: Spawned off LA’s Sugarfish. Cheap 6 piece hand rolls. $32 includes tax, tip, and a Mexican coke. Still room for dessert unfortunately.

item.title: Le Coq Rico
item.description: Specializes in French style chicken. $100 for a whole chicken. Chicken was soft and juicy with that wild flavor. Pretty expensive for what it is, but it was good. Probably would be OK with Costco chicken over this.

item.title: Patisserie Chanson Dessert Bar
item.description: Amazingly good albeit super expensive for a dessert tasting menu. Six courses plus wine pairing for $150+. Geez.

item.title: Raines Law Room
item.description: Cool place. It’s in some random building basement, and the couches are comfy. Feels a little noir-ish.
